alert.note: Alert for Rio Arriba (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 20 at 7:34PM MDT until further notice by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in New Mexico... Rio Chama Above Abiquiu affecting Rio Arriba County. Rio Grande Near San Ildefonso Pueblo affecting Los Alamos and Santa Fe Counties. Rio Grande At Rio Grande at Embudo affecting Los Alamos, Rio Arriba and Santa Fe Counties. Embudo Creek Below Dixon affecting Rio Arriba County. .Warm temperatures have melted snowpack and increased river flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR A DAM FLOODGATE RELEASE REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Snow melt and increased reservoir releases will cause the river flows to become high. Expect minor overbank flow downstream from the dam. * WHERE...Rio Chama above Abiquiu. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM MDT Saturday the stage was 10.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.7 feet tomorrow morning. - Action stage is 10.2 feet. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: To report flooding, contact your local law enforcement agency and your National Weather Service office when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning around 1000 AM MDT.
